french: Pour le jours des Hyacinthies,
english: For the festival of Hyacinthus,

french: Il m’a donné une syrinx
english: he gave me a syrinx

french: faites de roseaux bien taillés,
english: made from well-cut reeds,

french: unis avec la blanche cire,
english: joined with the white wax

french: qui est douce à mes lèvres comme le miel.
english: that is sweet to my lips like honey.

french: Il m’apprend à jouer, assise sur ses genoux;
english: He is teaching me to play, as I sit on his knees;

french: mais je suis un peu tremblante.
english: but I tremble a little.

french: Il en joue après moi, si doucement
english: He plays it after me, so softly

french: que je l’entends à peine.
english: that I can scarcely hear it.

french: Nous n’avons rien à nous dire,
english: We have nothing to say,

french: tant nous sommes près l’un de l’autre;
english: so close are we from one another;

french: mais nos chansons veulent se répondre,
english: but our songs want to converse,

french: et tour à tour
english: and as they take turns

french: nos bouches s’unissent sur la flûte.
english: our mouths are joined on the flute.

french: Il est tard,
english: It is late,

french: voici le chant des grenouilles vertes
english: here comes the chant of the green frogs

french: qui commence avec la nuit.
english: which begins at dusk.

french: Ma mère ne croira jamais
english: My mother will never believe

french: que je suis restée si longtemps
english: that I spent so long

french: à chercher ma ceinture perdue.
english: searching for my lost waistband.

french: Il m'a dit:
english: He told me:

french: Cette nuit, j'ai rêvé.
english: Last night I had a dream.

french: J'avais ta chevelure autour de mon cou.
english: Your hair was around my neck,

french: J'avais tes cheveux comme un collier noir
english: it was like a black necklace

french: autour de ma nuque et sur ma poitrine.
english: round my nape and on my chest.

french: Je les caressais, et c'étaient les miens;
english: I was stroking your hair, and it was my own;

french: et nous étions liés pour toujours ainsi,
english: thus the same tresses joined us forever,

french: par la même chevelure, la bouche sur la bouche,
english: with our mouths touching,

french: ainsi que deux lauriers n'ont souvent qu'une racine.
english: just as two laurels often have only one root.

french: Et peu à peu, il m'a semblé,
english: And gradually I sensed,

french: tant nos membres étaient confondus,
english: since our limbs were so entwined,

french: que je devenais toi-même,
english: that I was becoming you

french: ou que tu entrais en moi comme mon songe.
english: and you were entering me like my dream.

french: Quand il eut achevé,
english: When he'd finished,

french: il mit doucement ses mains sur mes épaules,
english: he gently put his hands on my shoulders,

french: et il me regarda d'un regard si tendre,
english: and gazed at me so tenderly

french: que je baissai les yeux avec un frisson.
english: that I lowered my eyes, quivering.

french: Le long du bois couvert de givre, je marchais;
english: I was walking along in the frost-covered woods;

french: Mes cheveux devant ma bouche
english: in front of my mouth

french: Se fleurissaient de petits glaçons,
english: my hair blossomed in tiny icicles,

french: Et mes sandales étaient lourdes
english: and my sandals were heavy

french: De neige fangeuse et tassée.
english: with muddy caked snow.

french: Il me dit: “Que cherches-tu?”
english: He asked: What are you looking for?

french: Je suis la trace du satyre.
english: I'm following the tracks of the satyr.

french: Ses petits pas fourchus alternent
english: His little cloven hoofprints alternate

french: Comme des trous dans un manteau blanc.
english: like holes in a white cloak.

french: Il me dit: “Les satyres sont morts.
english: He said: The satyrs are dead.

french: “Les satyres et les nymphes aussi.
english: The satyrs are dead, and the nymphs too.

french: Depuis trente ans,
english: In thirty years,

french: il n’a pas fait un hiver aussi terrible.
english: there has not been such a terrible winter.

french: La trace que tu vois est celle d’un bouc.
english: That's the trail of a he-goat.

french: Mais restons ici, où est leur tombeau.”
english: But let's pause here, where their tomb is.

french: Et avec le fer de sa houe il cassa la glace
english: With his hoe he broke the ice of the spring

french: De la source ou jadis riaient les naïades.
english: where the water-nymphs used to laugh.

french: Il prenait de grands morceaux froids,
english: There he was, picking up large cold slabs of ice,

french: Et les soulevant vers le ciel pâle,
english: lifting them toward the pale sky,

french: Il regardait au travers.
english: and peering through them.
